bioghist.p: Edgar Lawrence Smith (b. 1882) graduated from Harvard University in 1905 and worked as an economist, investment analyst and economic consultant. He wrote several books on finance, including Commons Stocks as Long-Term Investments (Macmillan, 1924), Bankers' Gold (Simon & Schuster, 1933), and Tides in the Affairs of Men (Macmillan, 1939).

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of nine volumes of works written by Edgar L. Smith. Titles include Bankers' Gold, Common Stocks and Business Cycles, Weather: A Clue to the Business Cycle, and Tides in the Affairs of Men. There are several pieces of correspondence and a newspaper clipping inserted into one of the volumes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
